content:
We seem to have two PRs with proposed message edit history colors:

  • https://github.com/zulip/zulip/pull/14128
  • https://github.com/zulip/zulip/pull/14617
  • There's also a question of removing the strikethrough styling on the deleted words.

Both seem better than what we have now. Can folks who have a better eye for colors look at those and suggest a plan? I think we should probably merge something to resolve the issue rather than being stuck, but feel pretty indecisive.
looks to me like #14617 has better contrast... if it looks too sharp on day mode though, you could take the colors from #14128 for day mode. I'm not convinced that's necessary though.

The red text on greyish bg is hard to read in #14617...may be it's just me
Or we can fix that by removing the strike-through
Also, I'm against removing the strike through, I feel like it's a useful indicator.
for me the red color by its own nature indicate that the text is removed...

Yash RE said:

Also, I'm against removing the strike through, I feel like it's a useful indicator.

Agreed.
@Tim Abbott I guess we should also deploy any of the above PR here..and let's see if folks having any issue
I went ahead and merged #14128 for now, as it's clearly progress, and didn't have messed up Git history. But I think it might be worth another small tweak on top of that.
I will try tweaking some colors and see if we can do something here
